intro: Tephroseris czernjaewii, commonly known as the Siberian sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern Russia. The plant thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its succulent leaves help it retain water, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid regions. Tephroseris czernjaewii is often found in alpine and subarctic habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
